predicate.note: Frames file for 'reach' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'gain' and 'get'

roleset.name: attain, get to

example.name: Proper parse
example.text: Deere & Co reached a tentative agreement with the machinists' union at its Horicon Wis plant.
example.arg: a tentative agreement with the machinists' union at its Horicon Wis plant.

example.name: Bogus parse
example.text: Any potential acquirer will have to reach some kind of accord with the company's employees.

roleset.note: Treebank often gives a bogus parse for (eg) "reach an agreement with John". Clearly it should be [reach] [an agreement with John], but Treebank has chosen [reach] [an agreement] [with John], probably because you can extract the agreement (ie, in passive sentences) but leave the PP "with John" behind. You'll have to follow the two examples above based on which syntactic parse is given.

roleset.name: contact

example.name: passive
example.text: Canadian Pacific couldn't be reached *trace* for comment.

roleset.note: Almost all examples of this roleset are passive.

example.name: with particle of direction
example.text: I had to reach back to French 101.

example.name: with body part
example.text: John reached out his hand to his sister.
